Spectral Modelling Functions¶

spectralradex.calculate_spectrum(obs_freqs, v0, radex_params)¶

Caculates the brightness temperature as a function of frequency for given input frequencies, \(V_{LSR}\) velocity and RADEX parameters.

Parameters

  • obs_freqs (iterable, float) – An array of frequency values in GHz at which the brightness temperature should be calculated.

  • v0 (float) – The \(V_{LSR}\) velocity of the emitting object to be modelled in km/s

  • radex_params – dictionary containing the inputs for the RADEX model. See radex.get_default_parameters()

for a list of possible parameters. Note this includes the linewidth in km/s that will be used to set the shape of the emission lines. :type radex_params:dict

spectralradex.rad_temp(t, frequencies)¶

Calculate radiation temperature for a given excitation temperature :meta private:
